content: <xml>   <records>        <record>       <contributors>         <authors>           <author>Daniel Mietchen</author>         </authors>       </contributors>       <titles>         <title>The transformative nature of transparency in research funding</title>         <secondary-title/>       </titles>       <doi>10.5281/zenodo.12589</doi>       <pages/>       <volume/>       <number/>       <keywords>         <keyword>peer review</keyword>         <keyword>research funding</keyword>         <keyword>research grants</keyword>         <keyword>open science</keyword>         <keyword>collaboration</keyword>         <keyword>science policy</keyword>       </keywords>       <dates>         <year>2014</year>         <pub-dates>           <date>2014-11-05</date>         </pub-dates>       </dates>       <abstract><p>This is a manuscript submitted to PLOS Biology on November 4, 2014 as a commentary on an accepted manuscript by David Gurwitz, Elena Milanesi and Thomas Koenig, entitled &quot;Grant Application Review: The Case of Transparency&quot;.</p>          <p>It was accepted on November 10, 2014.</p></abstract>     </record>      </records> </xml>
